title: Implicit Learning-Based Instructional Design for Skill Acquisition in Athletes with Disabilities (Swimming)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic swimming skills and comprehension of scientific theories
context.additional_context: Modular learning for employees with a real-time feedback system utilizing personal mobile devices.

learning_goals: Learners can design the skill acquisition process for disabled swimmers by applying implicit learning principles (using analogies and metaphors).
Learners can enhance the effectiveness of training programs by 20% or more using attentional focusing strategies (external/whole-object focus).
Learners can develop and apply three or more training scenarios based on contextual interference theory.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
